definition: surname Mi/name of an ancient state
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: Such the tendency is seen in the US' secret massages.
sentences.chinese: 从美国政府的密电就可看出这种趋势。

sentences.english: They hid the code under a tree.
sentences.chinese: 他们把密电码藏在一棵树下。

sentences.english: He was asked to hand on the key to a secret code to the guerrillas.
sentences.chinese: 他们让他把一份密电码送给游击队。

sentences.english: On one of the doors of this building there is a sign ‘Secret telegrams sending’.
sentences.chinese: 在一个房间的门上有“密电码发送室”的标牌。

sentences.english: One pitch came from the highest levels, the cables show.
sentences.chinese: 密电显示，其中一次游说涉及到双方最高领袖。

sentences.english: The aftermath of Cablegate led to the first publicly viewable infowar.
sentences.chinese: 密电门的余波让首次让公众一窥信息战的真面目。

definition: Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee/same as 軍委|军委
Wedemeyer (name)/Albert Coady Wedemeyer (1897-1989), US Army commander
Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general
Fu Zuoyi (1895-1974), Guomindang general, subsequently PRC top general and politician
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
